page.title: 06FLETCHING SCHOOL
page.content: The school was opened in 1824. At the turn of the century there were 189 pupils ages from 5 to 14 years. Today there are 49 pupils 5 to 11 years and numbers are gradually declining. Two main reasons are, first that Fletching is part of a conservation area, very little new building is allowed few new families move into the village children grow up and parents grow old in the family houses. Secondly council house tenants were reasonably mobile moving from village to village for larger accommodetion as families grew but since the present Conserative Government offered the houses for sale 80% are now privately owned. Parents remain in the larger houses they now own even when their children have left home. The average age of population grows older with fewer and fewer children. {D Skan
